712003f.title: Manhattan: 31st Street (West) - 6th Avenue
712003f.text:
109 West 31st Street, north side, west of Sixth Ave. (right, not seen).
The excavation on the right include:buildings at the N.W. corner of this
point. They were Nos. 103 and 107 West 31st Street and 521 to 525 (old
Nos.).Sixth Ave. Upon this excavation stands the 25-story Greely Square
Building. No. 109 in conjunction with 111 were demolished at a later date
and the open space used by the Nevin Bus Lines in 1936 as a terminal.
This set consists of a negative and a positive.
May 24, 1926.
0ift of Albert A. Volk Co.

709418f-a.title: Manhattan: 6th Avenue - 31st Street (West)
709418f-a.text:
Sixth AVenue, north from a point between W. 31st and 32nd
Streets, ard across the latter to Creeley Square, showing Manhattan's
famous shopping center. At the left margin are Gimbels and Saks
departrrrent stores.
The modern white center structure is the Hemald Square Building
and was erected sever1 years ago. T iis site formerly was occupied
by the Herald and which in turn had succeeded the old 71st Reg.
Armory. To the right is the Hotel McAlpin.
View No. 2 is photograpned from the S.W. corner of 32nd
Street and shows Greeley 30uare cluttered with subway builoing
materials. The "El" structure and its 33rd Street sttion will
be demolished in the latter part of Miarch and Easter will see the
entire Sixth Rvenue 'El" completcly relegated to the past.
February 18, 1939
P. L. Sperr
